title: Companies Have Shielded Buyers From Tariffs. But Not for Long.
summary: Cars, toys and tea are among products set to get more expensive as tariffs weigh on corporate profits.

title: A Major Crypto Pardon, and the N.B.A. Gambling Scandal With Mob Ties
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Letitia James Case Shows Ruthlessness of Justice Dept. in Trump’s Grip
summary: For the Trump administration, creating an aura of criminality around the indicted New York attorney general — through public scrutiny of her and her relatives — may be as important as a conviction.

title: Letitia James to Appear in Court as Battle Over Trump-Urged Prosecution Begins
summary: The New York attorney general, indicted by President Trump’s handpicked prosecutor in the Eastern District of Virginia, is expected to plead not guilty in her arraignment on Friday.

title: Rebuilding Israeli-Held Parts of Gaza: Workable or Another U.S. Pipe Dream?
summary: There are many questions about whether the idea is feasible or doomed from the outset.

title: Who Were the Palestinian Prisoners Freed by Israel?
summary: Under the cease-fire deal, Israel released 250 Palestinians serving long sentences for violent attacks. More than 1,700 others had been detained in Gaza and held without charge.

title: N.B.A. Gambling Scandal Reflects America’s Obsession With Sports Betting
summary: As legalized betting has become ubiquitous in American sport, the opportunities for cheating, like those outlined in a recent federal indictment, have multiplied.

title: NBA Gambling Scandal: What We Know
summary: Two indictments detailed schemes involving sports betting and rigged poker games, prosecutors said. The link was current and former N.B.A. players and coaches.

title: Can Ken Burns Win the American Revolution?
summary: Burns’s 12-hour documentary about our national origin story is landing in the middle of a culture war. Yes, it’s complicated. No, he does not want to talk about President Trump.

title: On a Roll, European Leaders Meet to Bolster Support for Ukraine
summary: Britain, the host, is framing a meeting of the “coalition of the willing” as an effort to fortify Kyiv for the winter fighting months.

title: Europe’s Persistence in Supporting Ukraine Is Bearing Fruit
summary: European leaders want to build on President Trump’s sanctions on Russia with new commitments of financial and military support for Kyiv.

title: The U.S. and Europe Are Trying New Ways to Pressure Russia
summary: For the first time in his second term, President Trump is imposing new sanctions, but they may not shift the course of Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: With Power Move on Rare Earths, China Plays Both Victim and Bully
summary: In weaponizing its dominance over the crucial minerals, Beijing is using tactics that it once denounced, potentially alienating nations it wants to court.

title: U.S. to Investigate China’s Compliance With 2020 Trade Deal
summary: The trade case is coming at a pivotal moment, before a meeting next week between President Trump and China’s leader.

title: South Korea Tries to Curb Anti-China Protests Ahead of Xi Visit
summary: The recent surge in demonstrations by far-right groups presents a challenge for the South Korean government, as it prepares to host both Xi Jinping, the leader of China, and President Trump.

title: How San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie Avoided Trump’s Enforcement Surge
summary: Daniel Lurie, the San Francisco mayor, relied on powerful tech executives and his own low-key approach to help his liberal city escape a rush of federal agents.

title: Trump Official Warns California Against Arresting Federal Agents
summary: Deputy U.S. Attorney General Todd Blanche told top California leaders that they would be prosecuted if they arrested federal agents performing immigration raids.

title: Can ICE Stop People Solely Based on Their Race?
summary: For decades, federal officers have had to rely on more than race or ethnicity to stop and question someone over citizenship. That is now being tested.

title: Trump’s Ballroom Project Claims 123-Year-Old East Wing
summary: Critics are outraged over President Trump’s demolition of the East Wing to make way for his $300 million ballroom. Others say it was time for change.

title: Renovations at the White House Aren’t Unusual. But Trump’s Makeover Is.
summary: Presidents have always tailored the White House to their needs, but with the demolition of the East Wing, a $300 million ballroom and other changes, President Trump isn’t wasting any time making it into his own project.

title: From Truman to Trump: A Tale of Two White House Renovations
summary: President Harry S. Truman consulted Congress, architects and a fine arts commission on everything from construction plans to fabric samples. President Trump is taking a different approach.

title: The Peril of a White House That Flaunts Its Indifference to the Law
summary: The White House has made no legal argument explaining its bald claim that the president has wartime power to summarily kill people suspected of smuggling drugs.

title: After Remark About Mamdani and Sept. 11, Cuomo Faces Democratic Rebukes
summary: When a radio host suggested that Zohran Mamdani would celebrate another Sept. 11-style attack, Andrew Cuomo chuckled. Democrats denounced the exchange as Islamophobic.

title: There Are 6 NYC Ballot Measures. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Voters will have a chance to weigh in on ballot questions concerning the housing crisis and when local elections should be held.

title: How to Vote Early in New York City, Where It’s Not Too Late to Register
summary: New Yorkers can vote early in the race for mayor and other contests starting Saturday, Oct. 25 — which is also the voter registration deadline.

title: Why Is There a Wasp Nest In the Living Room?
summary: These variegated, collaged-looking nests — fetching up to $250 each — are a recent fixation in interior design.

title: Crypto and Trump Corrupted America
summary: Trump has bared the corruption at the heart of crypto and the libertarian ideas behind it.

title: I Resented the White House Bitterly. Now I Mourn It.
summary: The East Wing was where Eleanor Roosevelt walked. It was where Jacqueline Kennedy planned the Rose Garden. Now it’s all but gone.

title: So Long, East Wing
summary: We look back at the history of this corner of the White House.

title: Stephen Colbert Tears Into the East Wing Demolition
summary: The East Wing now “looks like a rotisserie chicken your dog got into,” Colbert said on Thursday.

title: Hollywood Weeps as Warner Bros. Hangs a Sale Sign
summary: Losing the stand-alone studio, suddenly a real possibility, would be “heartbreaking,” one producer said.

title: After the Mexican Cartel Comes, They Pick Up the Pieces
summary: They arrive where the killings end, retrieving bodies, comforting families and bearing the emotional toll of a deadly struggle that shows no sign of stopping.

title: India’s Most Valuable Export: Tens of Millions of Workers
summary: India plans to send its vast work force abroad to countries with labor shortages, like Germany and Japan.

title: German Company Launches Ad After Its Lift Is Used in Louvre Heist
summary: The brazen daylight robbery of the Louvre on Sunday has turned into a marketing opportunity for Böcker, a German maker of cranes and elevators whose product was used in the heist.
